abstract: Bruce D. Hertzke, chairman and chief executive of Winnebago Industries, spoke about high gas prices and about how some people save the fancy trimmings for their R.V. instead of their house.
snippet: Bruce D. Hertzke, chairman and chief executive of Winnebago Industries, spoke about high gas prices and about how some people save the fancy trimmings for their R.V. instead of their house.
lead_paragraph: Recreational vehicles are not just toys for the rich, says Bruce D. Hertzke, 55, chairman and chief executive of Winnebago Industries, a big maker of R.V.’s and motor homes. Blue-collar workers, who have saved for retirement and travel make up a big chunk of the company’s business. Mr. Hertzke spoke recently about those customers, about feeling the pain of high gas prices and about how some people save the fancy trimmings for their R.V. instead of their house. Following are excerpts:

headline.main: Rolling Homes Aren’t Just for the Rich
headline.print_headline: Rolling Homes Aren’t Just for the Rich
